intro: Aegiphila diffusa, commonly known as the Brazilian bush or velvetleaf, is a shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or moist environments. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Aegiphila diffusa is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various soil types.
